greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,m) (n >= m >= 1) = number of line segments formed by drawing the lines connecting any two of the 2*(m+n) perimeter points of an m X n grid of squares.
comment: Take a grid of m+1 X n+1 points. There are 2*(m+n) points on the perimeter. Join every pair of the perimeter points by a line (of finite length). The lines do not extend outside the grid. T(m,n) is the number of line segments formed when these lines intersect each other, and A331452(m,n) and A331453(m,n) give the number of regions and the number of vertices respectively.
For illustrations see the links in A331452.
link: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..703 (the first 37 rows)
N. J. A. Sloane (in collaboration with Scott R. Shannon), Art and Sequences, Slides of guest lecture in Math 640, Rutgers Univ., Feb 8, 2020. Mentions this sequence.
xref: The first two columns are A331757 and A331765.
results.author: _Scott R. Shannon_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 27 2020
